headline: Campbell's Tuna Noodle Casserole
description: This tuna noodle casserole uses mushroom soup to add flavor to a creamy sauce that's mixed with noodles, tuna, and peas to make this family favorite.
name: Campbell's Tuna Noodle Casserole
recipeIngredient: 4 cups hot cooked medium egg noodles
2 (10.5 ounce) cans Campbell'sÂ® Condensed Cream of Mushroom Soup (regular or 25% Lower Sodium)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Stir cooked noodles, condensed soup, tuna, peas, and milk in a 3-quart casserole.
Bake in the preheated oven until hot, about 30 minutes; stir well.
Mix bread crumbs with melted butter in a bowl; sprinkle over tuna casserole and continue to bake until bread crumbs are golden brown and crispy, 5 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: I used cream of chicken soup and cheese instead of bread crumbs.
Just like Mom always made, great comfort food!
I used extra bread crumbs and butter with a little bit of season salt but really changed nothing else the first time and we all loved it. My grandchildren ate it up like a couple of grown men.

I always saute onions, mushrooms and celery and add to soup mixture. I was raised eating "Tuna Wiggle" and still love it every now and then, "comfort food!" I do my peas separately because not everyone likes peas.
VERY BLAND.

Cooked a whole box of penne pasta al dente'. 2 cups of milk and 1/2 cup sour cream plus large can of Campbell's Cream of Mushroom Soup (no water). sauteed 1 stick of chopped celery with fresh mushrooms. 2 cans tuna and 1 can crab. lots of cumin, onion powder, black pepper, ginger and touch of garlic. bread crumbs in melted butter. cheddar cheese on top. We love it! And we're going to have enough to share.

Great basic recipe. I made these changes, based in part on other reviewers' ideas: 1) I substitute one can of Campbell's Cream of Mushroom with Roasted Garlic for one of the Cream of Mushroom cans. Delicious! 2) instead of potato chips, I use fried onions bits. I put them IN the casserole, then also use them for the topper in the last 5 minutes of baking. 3) Sometimes I throw in some shredded mozzarella, if I want a cheesy version, but it's quite rich without it.
This was basic and easy but we loved it. Instead of bread crumbs we used butter and crackers similar to Ritz crackers for the topping. I'm looking forward to leftovers for lunch tomorrow!

My mother used this recipe for years. I follow it pretty closely with the exception of Campbellâ€™s Cream of Celery soup. I â€˜ve even made it with cream of chicken soup. This basic recipe is is easy and delicious. Add seasonings, fried onions, bar b que chips, whatever suits you and your family. I add shredded cheese sometimes. As written, great and 5 stars from our family. ðŸ˜‹
Great. I wanted to make this after feeling nostalgic for childhood meals. This hit the comfort food spot right on the nose! Will make again
I made this dish. I used cream of celery soup, chopped celery, black pepper.
I added more breadcrumbs to cover entire dish. The crunch adds to the experience!! VERY GOOD!
I loved it. It reminded me of when I was a kid. I'm going to try it with leftover turkey after thanksgiving. This was great.
This is something we have made for years. I do two pouches of tuna drained, 1 can cream mushroom soup, I add cheddar cheese, drain a small can of early young peas to mix in and itâ€™s great!
Super easy in the entire family loved it. Next time it'll have to be a double batch because it went so fast.

Why doubled the recipe and use 4 cans of tuna and a 1/2 cups of soup cause I know I'm gonna make a big one that we can eat off of and I'll follow the recipe to the tea think we've done this before and it turned out. Green beans that you get covered at the in the frozen section that have a bread into them we're gonna air fry them and we're gonna put them on our top bizarre bread instead of bread crumbs I want to try something different

Iâ€™ve never been a fan of tuna noodle casserole, but for some reason wanted to give it another shot. This was really good! I used kluski style noodles instead of regular egg noodles. I also used cream of onion instead of cream of mushroom (because I had both of those things already on hand) and panko with garlic butter instead of bread crumbs and regular butter (also because thatâ€™s what I had on hand). It was really good! I agree with the other reviewers about needing to double the breadcrumbs though, especially if you want the entire thing fully covered with them vs a slight sprinkle. I hadnâ€™t intended to change the recipe around, but I didnâ€™t want to go to the store so I just used what was in my cabinet. I think it would be good either way though
It worked perfectly. I did sprinkle parmesan on top of the bread crumbs

I add very small dice: red pepper, celery, white onion and 1 tsp. Garlic powder. Mix in before putting in oven. Do not saute first. Oh about 1/2 cup each. Makes for extra flavor and more texture. Try it you'll love it!
Subitute cream of mushroom with cream of chicken

Iâ€™ve made this before. Havenâ€™t used the bread topping though. Iâ€™m gonna try it today. I added garlic salt and pepper. Normally I would have put onions and red bell pepper, but, I was in a hurry today. Hopefully itâ€™ll still be good.

The recipe was amazingly simple. I made it especially for my husband and grandson and they both gave it the chef's kiss. The crumbs on top made it look especially appetizing. I believe it was a success, but I hate tuna. Based on the ease of recipe, my husband and grandson's reactions, and the appearance I give it five stars.
It was a great dish.
I love it , I did change peas for corn and used 1 can of cream of mushrooms and 1 of cream of chicken. I also double the ingredients for the crust for top for the last 5 minutes

I used pappardelle noodles added drained 15 oz. Can of peas and carrots to my half recipe. Added a little more milk to recipe . It made 4 meals for me . It freezes nicely. Topped with breadcrumbs mixed with oil and butter and Romano cheese. Before baking

Halved this recipe as itâ€™s just for my husband and me. Added 1 tsp worstershire sauce, 1/2 cup grated mexican blend cheese, 2tbs sour cream, 1-2 tsp dry minced onion, a few shakes of salt and coarse black pepper. Used frozen peas n carrots instead of just peas. For topping I used crushed potato chips combined with 2tbs Parmesan cheese. Two thumbs up!
I did 5 stars only because I added lawrys seasoning, and you must under cook your egg noodles and I used French fried onions instead of bread crumbs on low broil for 5 mins.
A very quick and easy supper. Classified under comfort food. Have it with a big slice of crusty bread.

I liked the basic recipe and I have made it 2 times. Each time I have changed it a little bit. When I make it for the third time I will use 3/4 cup peas, and four 4 oz cans of tuna. I will add 12 oz of canned mushrooms. The original recipe had too many peas and a little too much tuna. I use Trader Joe's low salt tuna which comes in 4 oz cans.
The recipe was fun and easy to make. One of my favorite comfort food dishes. Added a little shredded cheddar after baking. Really yummy.
WOW, this tuna casserole is awesome. Easy to prepare and delicious! Thanks for a great recipe.

I didn't precook the noodles. I put them in with the tuna, soup, peas and milk and baked it for 30 minutes. I also added a ranch seasoning packet to the mix as well as a ground pepper to taste. I didn't have enough bread crumbs so I added some crushed saltine crackers to my bread crumb/ butter mix.
First time I made this was in middle school. It was delicious then and it's still a family favorite!
Try this with slices of American cheese on top instead of bread crumbs. Trust me.
Loved this recipe!!

I made a larger batch by adding:
 3 cans of tuna (instead of 2)
 1 can of Vegall - minus the carrots
 1 small jar of sliced mushrooms
 Italian seasoning 
 Salt and Pepper
I cooked it with the breadcrumb topping, and then lightly added Mild Cheddar Cheese when it finished cooking. If someone wants more cheddar, it will be on the table. 
(I think it's a pretty good-looking dish)

It was really good and moist. 
I added an extra can of tuna for extra oomph!
Delicious! I also added shredded cheddar on top. So good and inexpensive. Play around with the ingredients to make it your own. Substitute peas with a veggie you like.
Add a pinch of salt and pepper and it's even better I'm glad I chose this to be my first casserole

Fam loves this recipe.. I use the whole bag of medium egg noodles, cooked al dente. I use 3 cans of tuna, a half can of peas instead of frozen, the 2 cans cream of mushroom, milk, and I also add a cup of Mayo for a little more creaminess. I add a cup of shredded cheddar cheese to the topping. Along with an extra tablespoon of breadcrumbs because the butter soaks up what it calls for. Kids love it with some ritz crackers.
It turned out good.I didnâ€™t make any substitute

So super easy! I work in adult family homes, and the people who live there absolutely love this! I love it because itâ€™s quick and easy to make, and I know everyone will eat it! I added onions and some mozzarella cheese to my mixture to give it a little more oomph. Easy and filling!!

This is great! My grandma has this recipe, and this is the closest I could find. I didnâ€™t have breadcrumbs, so I used Chex Corn Cereal. Itâ€™d probably be better with breadcrumbs though. I added a little water before I baked it to make it a little creamier. Yum!
A classic! Added dijon mustard and Cookie's seasoning to the mix. Delicious.

I used mixed vegetables and cream of asparagus since I did not have cream of mushroom soup. I added shreded Mexican 4 cheese on top instead of breadcrumbs. My family really likes it and it is a complete meal.
This was ok. I thought it was flavorless. My husband did like it, so thereâ€™s that .

Very bland. I wanted something quick, but should have read the reviews first. Also I made 1/2 the recipe and for me there were not enough noodles even after I noticed an error in the amount of noodles for 4. Something went wrong when I change portions to 4 to show only 1/4 cup. I put in 1 cup and still not enough. Also it really needs spicing up.
Very easy.
I use this recipe and I add garlic salt and plenty of pepper and add a cup of sharp cheddar to the mixture...really good!!
Needed more milk Needed spiced up-next time I'll add green chilis
Delicious! Used pasta instead & did not use bread crumb s or peas. Just threw the melted butter with rest. Turned out good. Thinking next time to jot drain tuna. Needs some liquid.

Good recipe. I added onions and sour cream, and I doubled the bread crumbs and added parm cheese. 
Iâ€™ll def make again!

Great recipe. Makes a simple, but hearty meal; winner every time! I do make one small change. Instead of using breadcrumbs, I use Ritz crackers, and before baking. I crumble the crackers all over the top. No need to measure, just cover to your liking. Then I place pats of butter all over the crackers, again no specific amount, just to your taste, then bake it. Cover while baking, removing cover the last 5 minutes. Gives it a crunchier top, and makes the dish just a tad richer, depending on how much butter is used. 

I also occasionally substitute cream of chicken soup for the mushroom when we have a dinner guest that doesnâ€™t like mushrooms. Works just as well, and doesnâ€™t change the taste at all in my opinion.
My family loved it!
Followed the recipe as written. I will make it again but will add some seasoningsâ€”salt, pepper, maybe some onion powder.

It hit the spot as the tuna casserole I remember from my youth. I used corn instead of peas, only because that is what I had on hand. We also used konjac noodles instead of regular wheat noodles. Still good!
No changes the first time. Reminds me of my childhood!

I did change the recipe to my liking. I used cream of chicken (instead of mushroom), I used mixed frozen veggies (instead of peas), I added mozzarella to the top and I put the crumble of the bread crumbs with butter on before I put it to bake. This was absolute perfection will make again 10/10
I put in cream of mushroom with roasted garlic, which gave it a great flavor. I used 3 cans and about 1/2 can evaporated milk. Put cheddar cheese on top.

Didnâ€™t make any changes, I made it the way it says too and the family enjoyed every bite. I will definitely be making it again, itâ€™s become a real family favorite.
It Was gone so quick I didnâ€™t even get a picture lol.
It turned out fantastic! It was my fault for not looking at the serving size because we have a LOT of leftovers however, I am looking forward to making this meal again!
Love it!!! Been making this recipe for 40 years!
Yes used caned peas instead of frozen. Put in with tuna soup then the noodles.
Very good, i had to use mixed veggies and didnt have anything to go on top..

This dish came out fantastic. However I did make a couple of changes. I used New England Clam Chowder instead of the Cream of Mushroom. For the topping I used 3 tbs of butter, 1 cup of seasoned breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup shredded Colby and jack cheese and 2 tsp of Old Bay Seasoning. So yummy

This dish came out fantastic. However I did make a couple of changes. I used New England Clam Chowder instead of the Cream of Mushroom. For the topping I used 3 tbs of butter, 1 cup of seasoned breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup shredded Colby and jack cheese and 2 tsp of Old Bay Seasoning. So yummy
Good comfort food recipe during the Covid. Especially since I had everything on hand and did not need to go to grocery store.
ready easy to make and delicious!
Pretty on point. I threw about a half cup of chopped carrot, onion and, celery in it. Just like my mom used to make.

I love tuna noodle casserole, but for some reason my first attempt resulted in a dry meal. I'll try it again but I'll try doubling the soup, perhaps using cream of mushroom and cream of celery. adding chopped celery.
My whole family loved this. I have 2 very picky eaters and they both gobbled this up. We had never had tuna noodle casserole before however this recipe made it a family favorite!
We didnâ€™t add the bread crumbs but sprinkled plenty of shredded cheese on top after we pulled it from the oven! So creamy and perfect for an easy dinner!

I did double the tuna because we like the extra meat. I used Italian bread crumbs but quadrupled the topping to cover the 9x13 pan- so 8T of breadcrumbs to 4T butter. We did add salt and pepper to the dish after it was served, one of my kids thought it didn't need the extra seasonings, the rest of us did. They asked for it to be in rotation for our menu. Hubby suggested adding Parmesan cheese to the topping so I'll give that a try next time- I just saw it in some of the other comments. Overall pretty good, just needs a kick of seasoning.
I made it with crushed cheese itâ€™s on the top. Yummy!!
I only used 1 can Mush soup, some chopped onion, 1 cup milk and 1/3 c cream cheese, mixed vegetables, top with cheese and Crushed potato chips. Very good!!

I didn't have any milk so pretty much had to wing it. I followed the recipe otherwise, but added about 3/4 cup of water (added and mixed in some to each can of soup separately and some to the noodle and tuna mixture.) I realized that cottage cheese is basically milk so threw in a little of that too. Mixed in some shredded cheddar because I'd never tried it that way before and to hopefully moisten it further. Added some onion and garlic powder and a few red pepper flakes. I also doubled the suggested topping and topped that with crushed Lays 'tater chips. I let it set up for 5 minutes before serving so it holds together better. The result was fine, but using milk really would have made it perfect. Still will definitely eat and enjoy this version though!
Used the Ninja foodi and followed the recipe, but the top of the casserole was burned. I'll use less temp. next time (maybe 350 or so).

I substitute everything in the recipe except the milk, but using the measurement basis help a lot. The ingredients I used came out pretty good. I used something green for the peas, margarine for the butter, something crunchy for the bread crumbs, another pasta for the noodles, another cream soup instead of cream of mushroom, and 2-5 oz. cans of tuna instead of 10 oz. weighted.
This is such a classic! A "family-friendly, kid-pleaser" every time! I add capers and Old Bay Seasoning to the mix...for a little extra pizzazz!

I used a bag of frozen mixed veggies instead of just peas. Also, salted and peppered and added a little paprika and shredded cheese into the mixture before cooking. Lastly, I added two more tablespoons of bread crumbs on top. It came out beautifully.

This is only a base recipe. You will need to add a substantial amount of salt, pepper and your favorite spices. I added a seafood blend along with some onion powder, parsley, chopped capers and grated cheddar. Cover that casserole for the first half hour w aluminum foil. Go wild with your choice of crunchy topping. I used potato chips
I used one can of cream of mushroom and one of cream of chicken. Plus several tsps of garlic powder and shredded cheddar (&/or parmesan) no peas.
I used cream of chicken soup instead of mushroom. delicious. added cheddar cheese to the top.

Yes, added French's Crispy Fried Onions into the mixture and 
crushed sprinkled on top.
good

I consider this a base recipe that needs added creativity. I used the ingredients called for but/except: I had no breadcrumbs on hand so used Pepperidge Farms country style cubed stuffing, which I crushed in a ziplock with a rolling pin (walaa- breadcrumbs!) and used about a cup with 1/2 stick melted butter fluffed together over top. Also I added dill weed ( fabulous w tuna), Natureâ€™s Seasons, and garlic powder, as well as sliced black olives, diced onions, and shredded Colby-jack cheese, all mixed in. My husbands mouth is watering waiting for it to come out of the oven.

I made something very similar but added 12 oz. of Velveeta Mexican cheese. I split the recipe in half and made 2 dishes: one half of the recipe with a can of condensed mushroom soup and the other half of the recipe with half of a can of condensed chicken soup and half a can of condensed cheddar cheese soup (I put less Velvetta in this one to tone down the spicy and used chicken soup because one person in the fam is allergic to mushrooms). So I used 3/4 of the Velvetta cheese with the mushroom soup one and 1/4 in the other. The last 5 min of cooking I topped one half with bread combs, 2 halves with french's onions, and 1/2 with the jalapeno toppers that are like french's onions (personally the jalapeno ones were my favorite topper). Both came out super good and the whole fam loved it and they are hard to please with new recipes. The one with chicken and cheese soup you could taste the tuna more. I think having more Velveeta cheese and more mushroom soup overpowered the tuna in the other. I would make both again and I would like to try it without cheese like it says in this recipe.
Added dried onion, black pepper and cayenne pepper.

I made this recipe, however I added to it. I grated 1 lb. yellow American cheese.

1. Place 1/3 noodle mixture on bottom of the casserole dish
2. Sprinkle 1/3 grated cheese
3. Repeat layers twice making sure to end with the cheese.
4. Cover and bake for 30 minutes.
5. Remove cover and add bread crumb mixture and bake another 5 minutes.
Sooo tasty!!
I made this just as recipe stated and was excellent . My husband loved it and will make again!
I add crushed up Jay's potato chips with butter and a small amount of bread crumbs yum then bake for the last 5 minutes
Very good!! Donâ€™t change a thing! Whose family loved it!!!
Definitely 1 of my families favorites.

Great tasting and so easy to put together. My family loved it. They want me to add cheddar cheese next time.
You'll want to make plenty of this one. It's a hit.

Used Italian green beans instead of peas. Mixed a fistful of grated cheese mix into the casserole, then baked as suggested. After 30 minutes, layered on more grated cheese mix and covered with dried onions and baked 7 more minutes. Onions got nice and brown and crunchy. Best tuna casserole Iâ€™ve ever had! Will make again and often.
Not a fan of peas so I substituted carrot chunks, celery, onion & mushrooms. That jazzed it up a bit. My family loved it!
I mixed in some garlic powder, parsley, and parmesan cheese to the bread crumbs. I did make extra for the top of the casserole.

I highly suggest swapping the frozen peas for frozen mixed vegetables. Iâ€™ve made this recipe a gazillion times but with mixed veggies. Tonight I tried it with peas and will never use peas again! Mixed veggies add more flavor and color.
